subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. I'm going to
talk today about the experiment in which
I've been engaged for the last three
weeks or so since I announced that there'
s a turning point here in "In Presence."
I began talking about such notions
as spiritual transmission and telepathic
hypnotic induction and so on. I am
aware of criticisms that have been
raised recently. Today is Tuesday. I'm
making this video on Tuesday and I've
just read the criticisms that Steve Stano
and Daryl and a few others have
mentioned, people who are uncomfortable
with the idea that I begin these videos
by staring into the camera
and concentrating. Well, it feels to me
like I am sending you something very
positive, perhaps at a telepathic level.
But I understand that some of you are
uncomfortable with that. Some
others of you have said, "Well, you're
really uncomfortable with yourself.
Jeffrey should go ahead and do what he
wants to do." But, here's how I feel about
it.
I don't want viewers to be uncomfortable.
Furthermore, I have told you earlier,
I'm a secular person. I don't want to set
myself up as a guru figure. On the other
hand, I'm well aware of the fact that
there are extensive traditions in the
spiritual literature relating to the use
of telepathy as part of the interaction
between a spiritual teacher and the acolytes,
novices, students, disciples, you know,
various traditions use different words
for it. While I do not purport to be
a spiritual teacher, I purport to be, if
anything, a parapsychologist and
a video host. Nevertheless, I am aware of
the fact that there is this vast
tradition in the spiritual literature
about the use of telepathy as a form of
communication, non-verbal communication,
let's just put it that way. And that
parapsychologists have virtually ignored
all of this literature and I don't think
that's appropriate so I do think it's
good to experiment with it. But, I also
don't want these New Thinking Allowed
videos to imply any sort of cultish
behaviour. I'm not trying to develop a
cult of followers. I'd love to have an
army of telepathic apes, so to speak,
hairless telepathic apes. But, I'm not
interested in setting myself up in any
way as a guru. So, my intention in
exploring these things with you is
really coming from a scientific
curiosity, a sense of my own personal
development and also an interest in
exploring as a parapsychologist what is
possible. Can we take some of the lessons
from the spiritual traditions and apply
them in a parapsychological context? Now,
the first thought is no, because after
all, these spiritual teachers, presumably,
are highly advanced souls. If they're
working at the dream level, at the
telepathic level with their students,
they're probably so advanced that they
know precisely what they're doing, and
have guidance from their own lineage, etc.
etc. etc. Here I am,
one might say, an amteur, which is
true.
I don't have a lineage backing me up
with any of this. But, it has occurred to
me there's something to be said for
simply a transmission, one might say of
who I am. And who I am is this: I'm a man
in my 70s.
I've lived now quite a few decades. I've
been exploring this realm for half a
century.
I'm also a person who has achieved a few
things that are very valuable in life. I'
ve found my own path. I found it long ago
and I've been living my own truth.
I've been centered in my own truth, more
or less, it's not as if I've never been
knocked off center. But I've had the
privilege of living on course, on track,
on purpose now ever since, one might say,
I had that dream of the Focus magazine
back in 1972. So, I do have something to
transmit here. What I'm thinking
is, well, I'm thinking about the concept
you sometimes hear in spiritual circles
of darshan. Darshan is simply sitting
with a spiritual teacher, being in the
presence of a spiritual teacher. I've
had that experience on many occasions
with a variety of spiritual teachers. I
don't consider myself a spiritual
teacher, it's not what I profess. But I'll
say this: I don't consider myself not a
spiritual teacher either. I am a
conscious being, you have to say, a
sentient being, that qualifies me as a
spiritual person. I've had life
experiences. I think I do have something
to offer. The trick is how to do
that without alienating people. It's not
as if I'm trying to do the Vulcan
mind meld to control any one of you. I have
no interest in controlling a single
other human being, other than myself. So,
nevertheless, I don't want the New
Thinking Allowed channel to become
something that it was never intended to
be. Here's what I'm thinking: at some
point it occurred to me it might be very
interesting and very useful for me to
create a video where I just meditate.
I'll just sit in front of the camera and
meditate and if I feel this sensation
that I have had, that strikes me as if
it's a psychokinetic transmission. You
might say, if I take all
I have learned and experienced in my 71
years and try to transmit that, that's
what's coming through. In a way,
that's what I tried to put into the
rainbow yin yang symbol also. Somebody
just suggested it needs a little more
black and white, I'll have to give that
some thought. But my point is this: I
do plan, I'm going to create a video
which, it may run for 20 minutes or a
half an hour, it'll just be there, me
meditating. For those of you who
would like to experience a kind of a
darshan with me, you'll see me meditating
on your screen and that's all you'll get.
But I'm not going to put it on the New
Thinking Allowed channel. I have another
channel, Jeffrey Mishlove YouTube
channel, and I'll put it there. We'll keep
it separate for those of you who want
that. I'm very curious because for
me this is like an experimental process,
it's trial and error. It's new for me.
I described this turn of events about
three weeks ago in one of the "In
Presence" segments. I do want to experiment.
But, as I say, I
have no interest in creating something
that begins to take on the trappings of
a cult.
So, just consider it me exploring
things. I think there is much to be
explored, there are so many
things that parapsychologists have
learned, but so many other things, vastly
many more things which I have
inklings that I'd like to share with you
from time to time. The idea that
because of the experiences of my life
that I do have something to transmit at
a non-verbal level, I want to pursue that
but we'll keep it separate from
anything on the New Thinking Allowed
channel. At least in terms of the
openings of the channels. Now, I'm getting
ready to end this "In Presence" segment
and it seems to me that to have a little
silence at the end is fine because if
you don't like it, just stop your video
at that point and I'll keep it going. I
have one more thing to say: how did it
start? Well, there's an interesting story
there, because you see, normally at the
beginning of every recording session I
start with at least 10-15 minutes of
silence. The reason I do that is
technical. It's because there's
air conditioning, there's a fan in this
room, there are sometimes background
noises from the building here. I
capture those sounds and then I filter
them out so that if you're listening to
the audio you don't hear that little hum,
or buzz, or shhh
sound in the background. It gets all
filtered out. I do that because perhaps
we'll create an audio blog someday out of
these videos. So, that's kind of how it
started. But, I don't intend to
continue with that practice any further.
So, those are my thoughts to share with
you today. Of course, I am interested in
your feedback. I do read the feedback. I
don't respond very often because I'm
also busy making these videos and
editing them and doing other
post-production. But once again, thank you
so much for being with me.
